text_block_list.text:
Back when I first met Narita Brian,<n>several months before
her astonishing<n>win in the Satsuki Sho...
Her running was, in a word,<n>"restrained."

text_block_list.name: Rice Shower
text_block_list.text: Huff... Puff...

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Gaaah... This's haaard!

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text:
Good run, you two! Keep it up! You'll<n>be ready for the next
race in no time!

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text:
There's some things you can't get<n>just by running! What
that is exactly...<n>I'll tell you when I think of it!

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
Uhhh, okay then. Anyway, that's<n>enough training for today.
Good job,<n>everyone.

text_block_list.name: Gold Ship
text_block_list.text: Whoo-hoo! Time to eat! Later,<n>alligator!

text_block_list.name: Rice Shower
text_block_list.text: Thank you, Trainer.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: See you tomorrow... Huh? Over there,<n>is that...

I follow Winning Ticket's gaze and<n>find a racer training
tirelessly.
Exhale...
Hup!
She moves flexibly, with powerful<n>strides.

It's not bad running at first glance,<n>but something isn't quite
in sync.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: That's Hayahide's little sister, Narita<n>Brian.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Yeah, but why's she out here training<n>alone? Shouldn't she
be with the rest<n>of her team?

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Her team... So she's debuted<n>already?

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Yeah, she's run five races, I think,<n>with two wins so far. It's
not bad, but<n>I get the feeling it could be better.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
After all, Hayahide gushes over<n>Brian—she calls her a
huuuge heap of<n>talent!

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: A heap of talent, huh?

The analytical Biwa Hayahide, a heap<n>of talent in her own
right, would praise<n>her sister that much?

Hearing that alone would've piqued<n>my interest, but then...
Not long after, I<n>find Narita Brian again in an<n>unexpected
place.

text_block_list.name: Skilled Trainer A
text_block_list.text:
There are some major athletes at<n>these tryouts. I've really
gotta think<n>things through before scouting<n>anyone.

text_block_list.name: Skilled Trainer B
text_block_list.text: Hm? Narita Brian's up next, but<n>didn't she debut already?

text_block_list.name: Skilled Trainer A
text_block_list.text:
I heard she dropped out of her team.<n>Things weren't
working out with her<n>trainer.

Tryouts are where racers who don't<n>have a team yet try to
be scouted by a<n>trainer.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
(Now I get why she was training on<n>her own, but what
happened with her<n>trainer that made her quit?)

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
(Now I get why she was training on<n>her own, but what
happened with her<n>trainer that made her quit?)
While I'm still pondering that, Brian's<n>race begins.

text_block_list.name: Caster
text_block_list.text:
And Narita Brian finishes five lengths<n>behind first! Did she
lose all her<n>energy before the last sprint?!

text_block_list.name: Caster
text_block_list.text:
With two Twinkle Series wins under<n>her belt, it's hard to
believe her result<n>today!

text_block_list.name: Skilled Trainer A
text_block_list.text: That was a great run! I'd love to have<n>you on our team!

text_block_list.name: Umamusume A
text_block_list.text: Y-yes! I'd love to join!

Seeing the other trainers approaching<n>Umamusume, I head
over to the racer<n>who caught my interest.

Seeing the other trainers approaching<n>Umamusume, I head
over to the racer<n>who caught my interest.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Hey, Narita Brian. Mind if we talk?

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: I don't think I did anything today<n>worthy of being scouted.

She's right—she didn't display much<n>of a performance and
lost speed near<n>the end.

Yet I can't help but think that<n>awkward running form of hers
is to<n>blame. And I have to know if I'm<n>right.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
Your flexibility and momentum were<n>good. Perfect form as
well.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
Your flexibility and momentum were<n>good. Perfect form as
well.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: But I think those pieces aren't fitting<n>together well.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Your form's too textbook. It'sholding back your power.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Your form's too textbook. It'sholding back your power.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Try running more freely, and let your<n>strength guide you.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: More freely... as my strength guides<n>me.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: Hup!
Whatever I was expecting, it wasn't<n>this.
Her stance is so low, she looks like<n>an animal on the hunt.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: Haaaaah!

text_block_list.name: Skilled Trainer B
text_block_list.text: Huh? Wh-what's up with that run?!

text_block_list.name: Umamusume B
text_block_list.text: Wow... And she keeps getting faster!

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Haha... She really is a heap of talent.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Haha... She really is a heap of talent.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
If you ran like that in the race, you<n>would've placed first for
sure.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
If you ran like that in the race, you<n>would've placed first for
sure.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
I still have to think about it too much.<n>Once I get the hang of
it, I'll be even<n>faster.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
Even faster than that? Well, can't<n>say I'm not looking
forward to it.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
Even faster than that? Well, can't<n>say I'm not looking
forward to it.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
If you don't mind me asking, why'd<n>you leave your team?
Your trainer<n>must've been proud that you racked<n>up two
wins.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
If you don't mind me asking, why'd<n>you leave your team?
Your trainer<n>must've been proud that you racked<n>up two
wins.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: Because I want to run more.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text:
Apparently I don't get consistent<n>results because I don't
know how to<n>keep my composure.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: So they said I needed to take a break<n>from racing.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text: Composure, huh...

She must not have a good handle on<n>her excitement when
she's<n>competing.

It's important to be hyped up, but a<n>racer also needs to
keep cool when<n>making critical, split-second decisions.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: But I didn't accept that explanation or<n>their decision.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: I understand why my trainermade that call, but I simply disagree.Nothing more, nothing less.

Wanting to run is as simple as it gets,<n>and she's certainly
strong-willed to<n>leave her team over that.

And she has the ability to turn that<n>passion into raw physical
power!

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
If we start now, we could still make<n>the Kyoto Junior Stakes.
There's the<n>G1 Asahi Hai Futurity Stakes too.

text_block_list.name: <username>
text_block_list.text:
If we start now, we could still make<n>the Kyoto Junior Stakes.
There's the<n>G1 Asahi Hai Futurity Stakes too.

text_block_list.name: Narita Brian
text_block_list.text: What's that supposed to mean?
